ARABIC: وَلَئِنْ أَرْسَلْنَا رِيحًا فَرَأَوْهُ مُصْفَرًّا لَّظَلُّوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ يَكْفُرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But if We send a wind, and they see it turning yellow, still they persist after that in being kafir.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If We send a (blighting) wind and they see (the earth) seared autumnal, they would surely become ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow, they would never cease to disbelieve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Even if We had sent the wind and caused (the plants) to turn yellow and to fade away, they would still have remained in disbelief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And if We send a wind and they see their fields yellow because of it, then indeed they would become ungrateful after it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if We send a wind, and they see it turn yellow -- behold, they then would become unthankful (disbelievers).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if We send a wind and they see it to be yellow, they would after that certainly continue to disbelieve
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But if We loose a wind, and they see it growing yellow, they remain after that unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if We sent a wind and they beheld it yellow, they verily would still continue in their disbelief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Yet if We send a wind and they see their harvest turn yellow, they will then begin to deny [Our favours].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if We send a wind, and they should see their tilth yellow, then they would thereafter remain disbelieving.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And if We send a wind and they see it turn yellow, they will surely become ungrateful after that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And if We (but) send a Wind from which they see (their tilth) turn yellow,- behold, they become, thereafter, Ungrateful (Unbelievers)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if We send a wind [which would spoil the green growth (tilth) brought up by the previous rain], and they see (their tilth) turn yellow, behold, they then after their being glad, would become unthankful (to their Lord Allah as) disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Yet if We sent a wind so they see it yellow, indeed after that they would still be unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But if We send a wind, and they see it turning things yellow, they would continue thereafter to disbelieve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [30:51] But if (wa-la-in, the lām is for oaths) We unleash a [different] wind, that damages vegetation, and they see it turn yellow, they would begin (la-zallū is the response to the [conditional] oath) after that, that is, after its turning yellow, to disbelieve, to deny the grace of [having been given] rain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if We sent a wind) cold or hot wind on their vegetation (and they beheld it) i.e. the vegetation (yellow) when it was green before that; (they verily would still continue in their disbelief) even after seeing it turn yellow, they would still disbelieve in Allah and show no gratitude towards Him.
